title:
Electromagnetic field near the common edge of a perfectly conducting
  wedge and a resistive half-plane
authors: I. M. Braver, P. Sh. Fridberg, Kh. L. Garb, I. M. Yakover
abstract:
The behavior of the electromagnetic field near the common edge of a resistive
half-plane and a perfectly conducting wedge is investigated. The possible
appearance of logarithmic functions besides power terms in the field expansions
at the certain angles between a resistive half-plane and the faces of the wedge
is indicated. It is shown that in the main terms of the electric or magnetic
field components perpendicular to the edge, logarithmic functions appear only
in two particular cases: when a half-plane forms a straight angle with one of
the faces of the wedge, or when the external angle of the conducting wedge is a
right one. Otherwise, the main terms of all components have a purely power
character and can be determined by the Meixner method. To confirm the
efficiency of accounting for the found field distribution law, transversal wave
numbers of the dominant mode of a rectangular waveguide with a resistive film
in a diagonal plane is calculated.
